official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt certain stock of real estate investment trusts
			 from the tax on foreign investments in United States real property
			 interests, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Real Estate Investment and Jobs Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Real Estate Investment and Jobs Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Exception from FIRPTA for certain stock of real estate investment trusts

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended—

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: by striking all that precedes

header.#text: Exception for stock regularly traded on established securities markets

quote.#text:
. In the case of any class of stock of a real estate investment trust, the preceding sentence shall
			 be applied by substituting

text.#text: by inserting before the period the following:
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

Stock of a real estate investment trust held by a qualified shareholder shall not be treated as a
			 United States real property interest except to the extent that an investor
			 in the qualified shareholder (other than an investor that is a qualified
			 shareholder) holds more than 10 percent of the stock of such real estate
			 investment trust (determined by applying the constructive ownership rules
			 of

that is eligible for benefits of a comprehensive income tax treaty with the United States which
			 includes an exchange of information program,
that is a qualified collective investment vehicle,

whose principal class of interests is listed and regularly traded on one or more recognized stock
			 exchanges (as defined in such comprehensive income tax treaty), and

that maintains records on the identity of each person who, at any time during the qualified
			 shareholder’s taxable year, is the direct owner of 5 percent or more of
			 the class of interest described in clause (III).
For purposes of this subparagraph, the term

would be eligible for a reduced rate of withholding under such comprehensive income tax treaty with
			 respect to ordinary dividends paid by a real estate investment trust, even
			 if such entity holds more than 10 percent of the stock of such real estate
			 investment trust, or
is designated as a qualified collective investment vehicle by the Secretary and is either—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or

text.#text: fiscally transparent within the meaning of

required to include dividends in its gross income, but is entitled to a deduction for distributions
			 to its investors.
For purposes of this subparagraph, the term

			 estate investment trust held by such qualified shareholder is not treated

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: In determining whether a qualified investment entity is domestically controlled—

a qualified investment entity shall be permitted to presume that stock held by a holder of less
			 than 5 percent of a class of stock regularly traded on an established
			 securities market in the United States is held by United States persons
			 throughout the testing period except to the extent that the qualified
			 investment entity has actual knowledge regarding stock ownership,

continuation-text.#text:
shall be treated as held by a foreign person unless such other qualified investment entity is
			 domestically controlled (as determined under this subparagraph) in which
			 case such stock shall be treated as held by a United States person, and

any class of stock of which is regularly traded on an established stock exchange, or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 2 of the Investment Company Act of 1940

text.#text: which is a regulated investment company which issues redeemable securities (within the meaning of

any stock in the qualified investment entity held by any other qualified investment entity not
			 described in subclause (I) or (II) of clause (ii) shall only be treated as
			 held by a United States person to the extent that the stock of such other
			 qualified investment entity is (or is treated under this subparagraph as)
			 held by a United States person.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended—

quote.#text: more than 5 or 10 percent, whichever is applicable,

text.#text: by striking

quote.#text: 5 percent or 10 percent, whichever is applicable

text.#text: by striking

The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply to dispositions on and after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.

The amendments made by subsection (b) shall apply to any distribution by a real estate investment
			 trust on or after the date of the enactment of this Act which is treated
			 as a deduction for a taxable year of such trust ending after such date.

The amendments made by subsections (c) and (d) shall take effect on the date of the enactment of
			 this Act.

is amended by redesignating subsection (d) as

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

header.#text:
Required notification of status as United States real property holding corporation; presumption of
			 foreign control for qualified investment entities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) is hereby
			 required to make its status as a United States real property holding
			 corporation readily accessible, and in the case of a publicly traded
			 corporation, publicly available. Under regulations prescribed by the
			 Secretary, such notifications may include disclosure of such status on
			 Form 1099s sent to shareholders, in annual reports, on websites, and, in
			 the case of privately held corporations, on stock certificates.

text.#text: Any United States real property holding corporation (as defined in

header.#text: Required notification of status as United States real property holding corporation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) will be presumed for purposes of section 897 to be foreign
			 controlled.

text.#text:

			 prescribe), any qualified investment entity (as defined in

header.#text:
Require FIRPTA withholding by brokers on sales by shareholders owning a more than 5 percent
			 interest

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by redesignating paragraph (7) as
			 paragraph (8) and by inserting after paragraph (6) the following new
			 paragraph:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) involving a broker (as defined in

), such broker shall be required to deduct and withhold a
			 tax equal to 10 percent of the amount realized on the disposition.

text.#text:
In the case of any disposition of an interest in a United States real property holding corporation
			 (as defined in

Subparagraph (A) shall not apply to sales of stock of a domestically controlled qualified
			 investment
			 entity (as defined in

header.#text: Domestic qualified investment entities and real estate investment trusts

text.#text:
Subparagraph (A) shall not apply if the transferee held a greater than 5 percent interest (or in
			 the case of the disposition of any class of stock of a real estate
			 investment trust that is regularly traded on an established securities
			 market, a greater than 10 percent interest) in the United States real
			 property holding corporation. In determining whether that threshold is
			 met, brokers are permitted to rely on public statements made by public
			 companies, including statements related to the status of the company as a
			 United States real property holding corporation or as a domestically
			 controlled qualified investment entity.

header.#text: Greater than 5 percent interest in United States real property holding corporation

text.#text:
Subparagraph (A) shall apply only if the broker had actual knowledge (or reasonably should have
			 known) of their withholding obligation.

header.#text:
Broker withholding obligation on certain dispositions of nondomestically controlled United States
			 real property holding corporations

header.#text: Interests in RICs and REITs not excluded from definition of United States real property interests

quote.#tail: at the end of clause (i), by striking the period at the end of clause (ii)(II) and inserting

text.#text:
neither such corporation nor any predecessor of such corporation was a regulated investment company
			 or a real estate investment company at any time during the period

The amendment made by this section shall apply to dispositions after the date of the enactment of
			 this Act.

header.#text:
Dividends derived from RICs and REITs ineligible for deduction for United States source portion of
			 dividends from certain foreign corporations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following
			 new paragraph:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
Regulated investment companies and real estate investment trusts shall not be treated as domestic
			 corporations for purposes of paragraph (5)(B).

header.#text: Dividends derived from RICs and REITs ineligible for deduction

text.#text:
The amendment made by this section shall apply to dividends received from regulated investment
			 companies and real estate investment trusts on or after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.
